summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of North Forty-third Street and East Forty-third Street, in the City of Seattle, from Stone Avenue to Fifteenth Avenue Northeast, by grading and providing and curbing the same, in accordance with Resolution No. 877 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
